channel.title: Emotes errors
channel.description:
Well, all of my emotes are bugged...
The character be crazy when I do some emotes... I just want to know how to fix these emotes...
Thanks!

item.title: Emotes errors
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

I Vain I:

So you use the shit Czars that pile everything in one class?

Delta is no better, as the “new classes” load everything from the client class anyway.

Read full topic

item.title: Emotes errors
item.dc:creator: @Marcuum Marcuum
item.description:
@Marcuum wrote:

Lol lol guys, calm down… We just trying to help the noob here (me), lol.

Trebaur, it does helps me, and what you said, Vain, helped me too.

I think I can know try to manage it…

TY everyone

Read full topic

item.title: Emotes errors
item.dc:creator: @TrebaurLul TrebaurLul
item.description:
@TrebaurLul wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=TrebaurLul link=topic=443632.msg3257517#msg3257517 date=1278229903]
Simply in client.java, open it and look for your current emote codes. Edit the emote ID’s and make them correct. Most server files have a file containing all the emote id’s for Yes, No, Wave, etc.

If you still have problems or your emote ID’s at the moment are correct, your going to have to do some client sided editing I believe.

Sorry if this does not help you.
[/quote]
ClickingMost.
Not Client.[/quote]

I don’t use shit delta bases, I know nothing about “ClickingMost”.

Read full topic

item.title: Emotes errors
item.dc:creator: @TrebaurLul TrebaurLul
item.description:
@TrebaurLul wrote:

Simply in client.java, open it and look for your current emote codes. Edit the emote ID’s and make them correct. Most server files have a file containing all the emote id’s for Yes, No, Wave, etc.

If you still have problems or your emote ID’s at the moment are correct, your going to have to do some client sided editing I believe.

Sorry if this does not help you.
